### EXISTING STRUCTURES
### Copper plate mine at position(x=41.0, y=-82.0)
Consists of following entities
-  Burner mining drill (position x=41.0, y=-82.0) and a stone furnace at position(x=41.0, y=-80.0)
-  Burner inserter (position x=39.5, y=-79.5) 
-  Burner inserter (position x=41.5, y=-78.5)
### Copper plate mine at position(x=60.0, y=-60.0)
Consists of following entities
-  Stone furnace (position x=60.0, y=-60.0)
### Electricity generator at position(x=106.5, y=-32.5)
Consists of 
-  Offshore pump (position x=106.5, y=-32.5)
-  Boiler (position x=111.5, y=-32.0)
-  Steam engine (position x=117.5, y=-30.5)
-  Pipe group (position x=107.5, y=-34.5)
-  Pipe group (position x=105.5, y=-32.5)
-  Electricity group (position x=114.5, y=-28.666666666666668)
### Transport system at position(x=40.5, y=-83.5)
Consists of 
-  Belt group (position x=40.5, y=-83.5)
-  Transport belt (position x=63.5, y=-53.5)
-  Transport belt (position x=64.5, y=-53.5)

### ERROR TIPS
### Errors when using burner entities
-  Ensure that burner entities have fuel before attempting to use them
### Errors when using steam engine
-  Ensure that the steam engine is connected to a boiler and a power source before attempting to use it
### Errors when using offshore pump
-  Ensure that the offshore pump is placed in a valid position before attempting to use it
### Errors when using electricity group
-  Ensure that the electricity group is plugged into an electric network before attempting to use it
### Errors when using belt group
-  Ensure that the belt group is not empty before attempting to use it

### NAMESPACE
*Important variables:*
- `EntityStatus`: an enumeration of entity statuses
- `Entity`: a class representing entities in the game
*Utility functions:*
- `get_entities_on_map()`: a function that returns a list of entities on the map
- `get_entity_status(entity)`: a function that returns the status of a given entity
*Failure modes:*
- `get_entities_on_map()` may return stale data if the map has changed since the last update
- `get_entity_status(entity)` may return an incorrect status if the entity has changed since the last update
*Success modes:*
- `get_entities_on_map()` returns a list of entities on the map
- `get_entity_status(entity)` returns the correct status of a given entity
